[vc_row full_width=”stretch_row_content_no_spaces” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” css_animation=”fadeIn” css=”.vc_custom_1588340287485{background-color: #f5f4f2 !important;}”][vc_column css=”.vc_custom_1592756988755{padding-top: 0px !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}”][vc_single_image image=”15640″ img_size=”full” alignment=”center” css=”.vc_custom_1609368390782{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” css_animation=”none” css=”.vc_custom_1592352285493{margin-top: 40px !important;margin-bottom: 40px !important;}” el_id=”data-science”][vc_column width=”1/4″ css=”.vc_custom_1592525501931{padding-top: 0px !important;padding-right: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;padding-left: 0px !important;}”][vc_custom_heading text=”Overview” font_container=”tag:h2|text_align:center” use_theme_fonts=”yes” el_id=”inner-hdln”][vc_wp_custommenu nav_menu=”73″ el_id=”inner-menu”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”3/4″ css=”.vc_custom_1592525594738{padding-top: 0px !important;padding-left: 30px !important;}”][vc_custom_heading text=”Data Science” use_theme_fonts=”yes” el_class=”red-hdln”][vc_column_text]Data Science is about extraction, preparation, analysis, visualization, and maintenance of information. It is a cross-disciplinary field which uses scientific methods and processes to draw insights from data.

Data Science has become one of the most demanded jobs of the 21st century. The number of roles for Data Scientists has grown by 650% since 2012. About 11.5 million jobs will be created by 2026 according to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics. Also, the job of Data Scientist ranks among top emerging jobs on LinkedIn. All the statistics point towards the growing demand for Data Scientists.

Data Science is an amalgamation of maths, computing, statistics and people. Skills that you’ll need to hone for a career in Data Science are as follows:

  • Statistics, Mathematics, and Machine learning
  • Coding languages like R and Python
  • Database management
  • Big Data tools like Hadoop, Spark, and MapReduce
  • Data mining, data munging, visualization, and reporting tools

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” css_animation=”fadeInUp” css=”.vc_custom_1609368234898{margin-bottom: 0px !important;background-image: url(https://sdbi.in/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/data-scientist.jpg?id=15642) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}” el_id=”data-scientist” el_class=”mb_padding_top”][vc_column width=”1/2″ css=”.vc_custom_1592354716056{background-color: rgba(20,20,20,0.6) !important;*background-color: rgb(20,20,20) !important;}” el_class=”mkb-bck-op”][vc_custom_heading text=”Data Scientist” use_theme_fonts=”yes” el_class=”red-hdln”][vc_column_text]

A data scientist is someone who applies tools and method from the statistic, machine learning and human intelligence to extract meaningful information from raw and unorganised data.  Someone who spends a lot of time in the process of collecting, cleaning, and munging data, as data can speak volumes, you just need skills to hear it clearly. Over the course of a day, a data scientist has to assume many roles: a mathematician, an analyst, a computer engineer, data miner, decision-maker and a trend spotter.

He is someone who:

  1. Understands a problem in Business, explore and analyze the problem
  2. Solves business problems using analytics in different fields
  3. Applies theory to practice
  4. Adapts to the changes in the various analytical platforms

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” css_animation=”slideInUp” css=”.vc_custom_1609368292778{background-color: #f5f5f5 !important;}” el_id=”skillsets” el_class=”mb_grey_bg”][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text=”Critical skillsets for a Data Scientist” use_theme_fonts=”yes”
